title: (Senior) Account Manager, Medical Surgical Business
abstract: You will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world.
content:
3M Health Care is now Solventum

At Solventum, we enable better, smarter, safer healthcare to improve lives. As a
new company with a long legacy of creating breakthrough solutions for our
customers’ toughest challenges, we pioneer game-changing innovations at the
intersection of health, material and data science that change patients' lives
for the better while enabling healthcare professionals to perform at their best.
Because people, and their wellbeing, are at the heart of every scientific
advancement we pursue. 




We partner closely with the brightest minds in healthcare to ensure that every
solution we create melds the latest technology with compassion and empathy.
Because at Solventum, we never stop solving for you.




The Impact You’ll Make in this Role
The Impact You’ll Make in this Role
As a(n) Account Manager/Senior Account Manager, you will have the opportunity to
tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and
diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:

 * Implements sales strategy for our medical solutions to assigned
   territories/hospitals/clinics with sales target.

 * Supports in sales and marketing event including but not limited to related
   demonstration, seminars, workshops, exhibitions, or customer training.

 * Creates new business opportunities and collects updated market insights for
   the team.

 * Provides professional service to assigned customers/hospitals.




Your Skills and Expertise 
 

To set you up for success in this role from day one, Solventum requires (at a
minimum) the following qualifications:

 * Bachelor’s Degree in a Science or a recognized professional qualification in
   Health Care or related Subjects

 * At least 1 year of sales experience in Hong Kong Health Care market




Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role
include:

 * Good command of both written and spoken English and Chinese, both Cantonese
   and Mandarin.

 * Excellent computer literacy, good interpersonal and presentation skills with
   group presentation ability.

 * Team player with high degree of integrity and responsibility.

 * Self-starter with career mind, self-initiative and be able to work under
   pressure.

 * Outgoing, hardworking, positive, and aggressive working attitude.

 * Experience in using Salesforce CRM




Work location:

 * Kowloon Bay




Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship
for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).




Supporting Your Well-being 

Solventum offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically
and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, Solventum regularly
benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

content:
【崗位職責】

1、全面賬務處理：獨立負責香港及 BVI 公司的全盤記賬、銀行對賬及會計分錄錄入，確保賬目準確無誤。

2、稅務申報管理：準時完成香港公司的利得稅、薪俸稅申報，並妥善處理 BVI 公司的年度檢續事宜。

3、審計與報告支援：協助年度審計工作，準備所需文件；參與編製月度管理報表及年度財務報表。

4、日常行政運營：高效處理辦公室日常行政事務，包括接待、通訊、會議管理、辦公用品管理及文件系統

維護。

5、系統與文件管理：熟練操作財務軟件（如 QuickBooks）及 Office 辦公軟件，確保所有財務與行政文件得到妥善歸檔與管理。




【任職要求】

1、大學本科或以上學歷，主修會計、財務、商業管理或相關領域。

2、 具備至少3年相關財務記賬或稅務工作經驗。

3、流利的普通話和英文使用，能作為工作語言高效溝通。

4、熟悉 MS Office 辦公軟件（特別是 Excel）及財務軟件（如 QuickBooks, Xero, Sage, 或類似軟件）。

5、有以下經驗者優先考慮：處理離岸公司（如 BVI, Cayman 等）賬務或年檢經驗者、持有相關會計資格者（如 LCC 中級/高級）、已獲取
ACCA、HKICPA 等專業資格者。

   quality and performance requirements

title: AI Infrastructure Network Manager, Data Centre
abstract: Ensuring network reliability, performance monitoring, and assisting in troubleshooting IP, BGP, EVPN, and NVIDIA InfiniBand (IB) networks.
content:
Job Summary:  

We are looking for a skilled AI Infrastructure Network Manager to support the
operation and maintenance of our AI-driven network environment. This role
focuses on ensuring network reliability, performance monitoring, and assisting
in troubleshooting IP, BGP, EVPN, and NVIDIA InfiniBand (IB) networks. The ideal
candidate should have solid experience in enterprise/data centre networking,
network management systems, and incident response, working under the guidance of
senior supervisors. 




Key Responsibilities:  

 * Network Monitoring & Maintenance:  

  - Assist in daily network inspections, performance monitoring, and health
checks for AI infrastructure. 

  - Support troubleshooting of IP networks (IGP/BGP), EVPN, and NVIDIA
InfiniBand issues. 

  - Follow escalation procedures for critical incidents and collaborate with
senior engineers. 

 * Network Operations Support:  

  - Work with network management systems (NMS) for logging, alerts, and basic
configurations. 

  - Assist in implementing network changes and optimizations under supervision. 

 *  Vendor & Documentation Coordination:  

  - Liaise with vendors (Cisco, Huawei, NVIDIA) for hardware/software support as
needed. 

  - Maintain network documentation, including topology diagrams and incident
reports. 

 * Team Collaboration:  

  - Work closely with senior network supervisors and cross-functional teams. 

  - Provide guidance to junior engineers on standard procedures. 




Qualifications & Experience:  

 * Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, Telecommunications, or
   equivalent qualification.

 * Experience:  8-12 years in network operations, preferably in data
   centre/cloud/AI environments. 

 * Hands-on experience with IP networking (OSPF/BGP), EVPN, and basic InfiniBand
   knowledge. 

 * Familiarity with network monitoring tools (e.g., SolarWinds, Nagios,
   Prometheus). 

 * Certifications (Preferred but Not Mandatory):  

 * Cisco (CCNA/CCNP), Huawei (HCIP), or NVIDIA networking certifications. 

 * Soft Skills:  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills & Ability to work
   in a team and follow operational protocols. 

 * Language Skills: Fluent in English and Mandarin; Cantonese proficiency is a
   strong plus.

 * Preferred Skills:  Exposure to AI/ML infrastructure or high-performance
   computing (HPC) & Basic scripting skills (Python/Bash) for network automation
   tasks. 




Interested parties please apply in full resume with current and expected salary
by e-mail to hr@cmi.chinamobile.com [hr@cmi.chinamobile.com].  Please indicate
the reference in the subject line.




All personal data collected will be used for recruitment and employment related
purpose only.

Join us & Be eCommerce Innovators
Are you looking to be part of revolutionizing online shopping behaviour and
experience? We are a well-esteemed eCommerce company that operates multiple
eCommerce websites internationally. We are now looking for potential talent to
help us expand our new beauty and fashion business worldwide and to build brand
awareness and sales revenue.

Key Job Responsibilities: 

 * Execute & optimize end-to-end campaigns across EDM, SMS & WhatsApp to boost
   customer retention and LTV.

 * Develop compelling content and design high-conversion offers/promotions for
   retention purpose.

 * Lead junior team members in daily operations, target achievement, and
   performance analysis.

 * Manage segmentation strategies to personalize messaging across customer
   journey stages.

 * Analyze campaign performance (deliverability, open rate, click-through rate,
   conversion rate) to derive actionable insights with the use of data.

 * Collaborate with creative teams to produce channel-specific assets that align
   with brand guideline.

 * Stay ahead of trends in messaging compliance (GDPR, TCPA) and emerging tech
   (RCS, WhatsApp Business API).

 * Monitor budgets and ROI for owned channels with monthly performance
   reporting.

 

 Desired Skills and Experience: 

 * Bachelor’s degree in Marketing/ Business/ eCommerce or related disciplines.

 * 3+ years’ hands-on experience executing EDM/SMS/WhatsApp marketing
   campaigns, preferably in beauty e-commerce.

 * Proven expertise with marketing automation tools (e.g., Klaviyo, Braze,
   Omnisend, Mailchimp, Sleekflow).

 * Leadership experience guiding junior team members with target-driven
   approach.

 * Strong analytical skills with ability to translate data into
   retention-focused strategies.

 * Well-organized, detailed minded, result oriented, strong problem-solving
   skills, and able to manage multiple tasks.

 * Self-motivated, aggressive, able to work independently and under pressure, as
   well as cooperate well with team and stakeholders to achieve company goals.

 * Equipped with beauty industry knowledge, including a strong understanding of
   purchase cycles, key competitors, and customer behavior.

 * Portfolio showcasing successful retention campaigns with measurable results.

 * Excellent command of written and spoken English, Cantonese and Mandarin.

 * Less experienced candidates may be considered for Supervisor role.

 

We offer friendly team environment, good career prospect, also attractive
remuneration package including discretionary bonus incentive, together with

medical and dental insurance. Interested parties please send full resume with
available date, present and expected salary by clicking “Apply Now” for an
interview.

All personal data collected will be used for recruitment purpose only.

title: Home Merchandiser
abstract: Join Myer and you will be the key to your success in this role. Myer offers a competitive remuneration package and a rewarding career to you.
content:
MYER SOURCING ASIA LIMITED 

Myer Sourcing Asia Limited is a wholly owned subsidiary of Myer Australia Pty
Ltd. We are looking to recruit a Home Merchandiser. This is an exciting
opportunity and we are looking for passionate people to join our Business in
Hong Kong.

As the Home Merchandiser (Home Décor, Soft Home, Bath Accessories), you will
report to the Head of Merchandise in the Hong Kong office. You will be the
primary contact with the buying team and suppliers for the Home category, and
responsible for sourcing of appropriate vendors and suppliers, coordination
between key players in the supply chain, production management, tracking and
reporting. 

This role is pivotal in the success of the global sourcing office. You will
ensure that product development timelines are met and work closely with the
Buying teams to ensure orders can be fulfilled as per the specified brief.


 


HOME MERCHANDISER

Key job tasks/duties/responsibilities:

 * Pre-order placement activities including product & vendor sourcing, product
   development, buying trip preparation, quotation and samples coordination 

 * Daily merchandising activities including order management, sampling,
   packaging, WIP tracker update, supplier management, critical path management

 * Evaluate product quality and packaging, and provide suggestion to minimize
   cost

 * Negotiations with vendors on costs, MOQ, packaging, sampling & delivery

 * Responsible for the color evaluation on the printed packaging

 * Work closely with vendors and counterparts in Australia on sampling &
   packaging approval  

 * Work closely with Quality Assurance Team and vendors on product testing and
   inspection arrangement

 

To be successful in this role you will need:

 * At least 3 years’ experience in Hard & Soft Home category (Home décor,
   bathroom accessories, bedding) 

 * Experience in working with buying office preferred, trading or manufacturing
   background with solid product knowledge will be also considered

 * Energetic, self-motivated, proactive, detail-oriented, and independent
   working style

 * Desire to own decisions and take responsibility for outcomes 

 * Demonstrated experience working with manufacturers, suppliers, or
   distributors

 * Strong factory / vendor base is an advantage  

 * Strong planning and organizational skills 

 * Demonstrated exceptional written and oral communication skills 

 * Fluency in English, Cantonese and Mandarin

 * Good MS Office (Excel / Word / PowerPoint / Outlook) skills 

 * Bachelor’s Degree/Tertiary Qualification is preferred but not essential

Candidates should list the product categories you had been handled

Immediate available is preferred

title: Operation Executive, KYC (MJ006433)
abstract: KPMG China provides multidisciplinary services from audit and tax to advisory, with a strong focus on serving our clients’ needs and their industries.
content:
KPMG China provides multidisciplinary services from audit and tax to advisory,
with a strong focus on serving our clients’ needs and their industries. Not only
do we have an overriding commitment to provide the highest quality services for
our clients, but we also strive to become a responsible corporate citizen that
has a positive impact on our environment and community. At KPMG, you’ll
translate insights into action and reveal opportunities for all—our teams, our
clients and our world.




Service Line Overview

KPMG Managed Services brings together the firm’s subject matter expertise,
proprietary technology and tools and deep operations capability to provide an
innovative and cost effective solution for clients seeking to outsource either a
one-off remediation or an ongoing BAU process. We operate across multiple
industries, geographies and processes and have particular experience in
complaint handling, claims processing and client due diligence.  




The role of the Analyst is responsible for conducting a periodic review in line
with client policy to fulfil Know Your Customer (KYC) requirements. You will be
expected to deliver against targets for both productivity and quality, managing
your own pipeline and taking onboard feedback from approvers who are responsible
for quality checking cases.




Key Responsibilities

·      Deliver high standards of quality

·      Develop and maintain knowledge of policy and processes to ensure
consistent competency and KPIs are met

·      Manage caseload throughout the end to end process in a timely manner

·      Monitor own performance to ensure personal targets standards are met

·      Be effective in finding data from a number of sources/systems and
accurately transfer

·      Maintain personal compliance of operational and regulatory risk

·      Work flexibly in a high performing team to ensure team goals as well as
personal deliverables are achieved




Experience & Background

·      6 months Investment Banking KYC experience is preferred

·      Experience of using external data sources.

·      Articulate in both written and verbal communication in English and
Chinese.

·      Understanding of KYC principles and in-depth knowledge of corporate
structures

·      Working knowledge of MS office- Excel, Word, Outlook and other
applications

·      Working successfully in a target driven operational environment 

·      Ability to manage performance and targets in a fast paced, pressured
environment

·      Ability to work alone or in a team

·      Highly motivated

·      Evidence of having an analytical approach

·      Experience of working in a financial environment

·      Exposure to KYC for complex legal entities and Enhanced Due Diligence
(EDD)

·      Basic understanding of AML and Sanction process. 




About KPMG

At KPMG China, we are committed to being an equal opportunity employer, with
zero tolerance for any form of discrimination against any persons. It is
important for us to create an inclusive, diverse and agile workplace for our
people to develop and thrive at both a personal and professional level.




We strive to make ESG (environmental, social and governance) a watermark running
through our organisation; from empowering our people to become agents of
positive change, to providing better solutions and services to our clients to
help them achieve their ESG goals. View Our Impact Plan to learn more about our
ESG commitments and progress across four key pillars - Governance, People,
Planet and Prosperity – and how we make a positive impact on our people,
environment and society.




We encourage you to come as you are, and we welcome all qualified candidates to
apply, and hope you unlock opportunities with us. Visit KPMG China website for
more company information.

title: Associate Director, Transformation (Government & Infrastructure) (MJ005674)
abstract: KPMG China provides multidisciplinary services from audit and tax to advisory, with a strong focus on serving our clients’ needs and their industries.
content:
KPMG China provides multidisciplinary services from audit and tax to advisory,
with a strong focus on serving our clients’ needs and their industries. Not only
do we have an overriding commitment to provide the highest quality services for
our clients, but we also strive to become a responsible corporate citizen that
has a positive impact on our environment and community. At KPMG, you’ll
translate insights into action and reveal opportunities for all—our teams, our
clients and our world.




Service Line Overview

KPMG’s Government and Infrastructure Advisory team works across the breadth of
clients working in the public realm. This includes agencies of the Government of
Hong Kong SAR, Statutory Authorities, Public Institutes and Non-Government
Organisations as well as private companies. We combine best practice functional
capabilities across technology consulting, managed services, infrastructure
projects, risk consulting and ESG – and combine this with a deep understanding
of the economic, social, environmental, political and financial drivers shaping
the Government & Public Sector landscape.




We are looking for an Associate Director / Director with 10+ years of experience
in the Government & Public sector with strong focus on infrastructure. Strong
capability of business development / account management together with proven
track record of delivery of large and complex infrastructure programmes, both
within the construction industry and consultancy firms, is key for this role.
Being a client facing role, the candidate is required to bring their own network
of industry contacts as well as instigating and developing new client
relationships.




Key Responsibilities

Originate & Convert

 * Work with Sector Leaders, Function Teams and Account Teams to understand the
   key plans and establish good working relationships with leaders across these
   areas

 * Instigate and develop key client relationships in new areas of focus

 * Identify new major pursuits and develop and execute major pursuit plans
   including Contact Mapping, identifying and working with Sector, Markets &
   Functions team members to maximise our chances of success on priority targets

 * Proactively manage the pipeline of Government & Public Sector target
   opportunities and liaise with all internal stakeholders to assist in early Go
   / No-Go decision making

 * Work collaboratively with Pre-Sales / Function teams to ensure Go To Market
   Material is adequate for client / opportunity pursuits

 * Regularly update key stakeholders on the market and client issues with
   respect to the public sector

 * Support the build of key client relationships, including the development of
   client stakeholder mapping and client contact lists and activities to drive
   more interactions with key clients

 * Understanding of KPMG-wide services, solutions, thought leadership to
   determine which programs, events and initiatives would be relevant to the key
   clients

 * Undertake capability gap assessments and competitor analysis

 * Identify key Pipeline opportunities that may need regional/global support to
   enhance the win rate of regional/global opportunities

 * Suggest and contribute to ways we can collectively win more pursuits in the
   sector/accounts that you support




Delivery

 * Setting up, initiating and delivery of engagements originating from
   successfully converted opportunities

 * Leading as lead client partner for selected infrastructure clients to oversee
   holistic delivery of suite of engagements

 * Nurture and develop talent pool internally for deployment and delivery of
   engagements

 * Active involvement in project delivery through forming and leading teams
   originating from various KPMG functions and third-party partners as required
   by engagement needs

 * Inquisitive mindset paired with deep sector knowledge to act upon challenging
   clients’ requests for the success of the project

 * Adaptive to changing environment through good connectivity within the KPMG
   global infrastructure team and wide network of industry contacts  

 

Experience & Background

 * Minimum of 10+ years work experience with significant experience in sector /
   account / business development roles

 * Proven track record in delivery of large, complex infrastructure projects /
   programmes (incl. PPP), with experience gained in the client / contractor
   field and / or working on consultancy projects

 * A recognised degree in relevant disciplines, preferably in finance,
   accounting, engineering, surveying or project management related disciplines;

 * A professional qualification in finance, accounting, engineering, surveying
   or project management is an advantage, e.g. CFA, HKICPA, HKIE, ICE, IMechE,
   RICS, APMP or equivalent;

 * Demonstrate leadership and people management skills and the ability to
   influence at all levels of the organization

 * Consulting Sector and Client-side Public Sector experience highly desirable

 * Sound understanding of business functions such as Technology, Project &
   Change Management, IT, Finance, MI Reporting, Enterprise Risk Management,
   Procurement & Vendor Management, ESG and Public Infrastructure

 * Demonstrable competency in strategic planning and business development

 * Working knowledge of data analysis and performance/operation metrics

 * Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills in English
   to be able to articulate coherently from conceptual discussions to
   complicated situations

 * Excellent interpersonal skill to be able to build professional relationships
   and represent the business internally or externally

 * Superb problem-solving skills, dynamic and innovative mindset

 * Excellent command of the detail and the big picture

 * Willingness to travel.




About KPMG

At KPMG China, we are committed to being an equal opportunity employer, with
